pages.body:
# Welcome to ZeroWiki !

[[ZeroWiki]] is a wiki platform for [[ZeroNet]], the distributed web network based on [[Bittorrent]], [[Bitcoin]] and [[Tor]]. 

[[ZeroWiki]] is public, [[cloning|clonable]] and editable. Wikis can be used for taking notes, storing snippets, sharing knowledge by creating [[FAQ]]s and documentations, keeping track of your goals, or as a simple to-do lists. See the [[help|help page]] for a more in-depth view of how it works.

## Useful pages

- [[zeronet|What is ZeroNet?]]
- [[zite|What is a "zite"?]]
- [[ZeroWiki:Format|ZeroWiki writing format]]
- [[List of Zites]]
- [[Dev ideas|Development ideas]]
- [[proxies|List of proxies, allowing you to view ZeroNet from clearnet]]

*Please note that [[ZeroWiki]] is still beta software, it may have bugs and lack some features. [[ZeroWiki:Issues|Propose features and report bugs here]].*

# Source Code **Source code** is the base code for programs. It's written in a programming language such as [[PHP]], [[Python]], [[HTML]], etc. Source code is the base for everything you see on a computer, anything from a webpage, to a music playing program is built by writing source code. ## Source code for a basic HTML webpage Basic html webpage

Basic html webpage

This is a basic html webpage.

**Anonymity** is where your identity is unknown and/or hidden to other peers.

**Anonymous** is a leaderless group of hacktivists with an origin in 4chan. Instead of following under a single, or group of, leader(s), the group is more like a tree; it's roots all leading back to the one group but it spreads off into branches encompassing operations, and small "cells" of activists.

# Wiki

A **wiki** is a type of website in which users can edit and contribute to its content. Examples of wikis include Wikipedia (also referred to as "jewpedia"), Wiktionary, ZeroWiki and the Debian Wiki. The word 'wiki' comes from Hawaiian, meaning fast or quickly. Wikis are increasingly popular popular with community groups and small organisations, and are recognized as a type of 'Web 2.0' site.

Most wiki's are typically a collection of information on a specific subject such as Linux or many different subjects such as everything from Pizza to The origin of the Internet.

#Magnet Links

'Magnet links' are strings of text you paste into a [[torrent client]] to find and download torrents from [[peers]].
You can find Magnet Links for [[torrent]]s on most torrent websites, ie. [[thepiratebay]]

# Cloneable

A [[zite]] is cloneable when 'cloneable' has been set to true in it's [[content.json]] file. This enables the site to be easily cloned from the [[ZeroNet]] homepage. Cloning a site duplicates it and sets any data files back to their default. The result is a new site running on the same code and structure as the source. 
Many zites take advantage of the cloning feature and allow ZeroNet to be flexible and free. [[ZeroTalk]] uses it to create custom, independent, reddit-like forums. [[ZeroWiki]] can be cloned to make new specialized wikis. [[Kaffiene]] has enabled cloning to encourage competition and growth amongst ZeroNet [[search engine]]s. Most users, however, are probably most familiar with cloning [[ZeroBlog]] to have their own personal blog site.
